Package edu.odu.cs.cs350

Class ShoppingCart

java.lang.Object
edu.odu.cs.cs350.ShoppingCart
public class ShoppingCart extends Object
The shopping cart tracks items that customer would like to purchase. A typical sequence involving it would be ShoppingCart cart = new ShoppingCart(); cart.addItem ("pins", 75, 01); addItem will take the name of an item (String), the quantity being ordered (int), and the unit cost (int). Costs are measured in pennies. The cart must track the number of distinct items being ordered. The above addCart call adds one distinct item, but 75 instances of that item. If additional "pins" are ordered, they will add to the quantity but not the number of distinct items. The cart must also track the total cost of all items in the cart. This is defined as the sum over all distinct items ordered of the quantity ordered times the unit cost. For example, after the sequence: ShoppingCart cart = new ShoppingCart(); cart.addItem ("pins", 75, 01); cart.addItem ("needles", 50, 02); cart.addItem ("pins", 25, 01); cart.addItem ("widgets", 1, 250); then cart.numberOfItems() would return 3, and cart.totalCost() would return 450. haha poop
